title: Timer has been removed from F-Droid!
body:
Can you please fix this issue?

https://forum.f-droid.org/t/many-old-unmaintained-apps-have-been-archived/670

title: saved countdowns
body: Would be nice if we could save often used countdowns for quick selection.

title: Translation
body:
Hi, I'd like to translate your app into Italian and Esperanto but I don't know how to do that.
Could someone explain it in a "How to contribute" section of a README.md file that should be created? Thank you very much!

title: sometimes stopwatch gets corrupted
body:
Not sure if the project is still maintained, but here I go. 

On several occasions the Stopwatch got corrupted. Either hitting Reset button wouldn't do anything. Or the Start/Stop and Reset buttons disappeared. Or all the recording laps timings would vanish, _without_ my hitting the Reset button. It happened several times already, but I don't have a recipe to reproduce just yet. All I know is that this happens when I'm using the Lap functionality for several times...

title: Added localization (now English and Italian) and a new tab where is
Alarm notification silent or vibrate
body: Could there be an option for the alarm notification to be silent or vibrate?

title: 24-hour clock
body:
Could Timer have an option to show time in 24-hour format?

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/24-hour_clock

title: Prevent device sleep
body: Nice app.  When I'm using the countdown timer I'd like to be able to prevent the device from sleeping.  This could be an optional setting.

title: add button to control screen
body: It would be nice to have a button to enable/disable screen off during a stopwatch or a countdown.

title: Release 1.3
body: Extracted strings to enable localisation of the application.

title: instant crash on kitkat on startup
Missing org.dpadgett.timer.R
body: I import the files into Eclipse using the Existing Android Application filter. I get a bunch of build errors about missing org.dpadgett.timer.R. Cleaning the project doesn't generate it.

title: Make ending the alarm from the lock screen possible
body: If your phone requires a pin or a password to unlock this can make turning off the alarm a real hassle because you first have to enter your pin/password before stopping the alarm. It would be great if it was possible to stop the alarm from the lock screen itself.

title: Autostart countdown timers via exported activity
body:
I was thinking about your idea to autostart countdown timers. As far as I can tell, the app "NFC Task Launcher" only allows you to specify an applications activity to start. It does not allow any parameters to be passed. I don't know if this is a shortcoming of "NFC Task Launcher" or of Android.

Alternatives:

1 - Export multiple CountdownTimerAutostartX activities for standard lengths of time. For example, CountdownTimerAutostart5minutes, CountdownTimerAutostart15minuntes, CountdownTimerAutostart60minutes. When the activity is launched, and there isn't a currently running timer, then start one for the time specified. If there is a timer running, then add the length of time to the current running timer. The user could setup a 20 minute timer by using the 5 and 15 minute NFC tags.

2 - Export a single CountdownTimerAutostart that simply takes you straight to the countdown Timer tab.

3 - No reason you can't do both 1 and 2.

Thoughts?

title: Release 1.2 nfc
body:
Hi,

I forked your project to add in an auto-start stopwatch hook for NFC.

Apps like "NFC Task Launcher" (http://goo.gl/tH3Dx) can program an NFC tag with an application's activity. When the phone/tablet is brought near that NFC tag, the application is started at that activity.

I extended Timer to add the activity "StopwatchAutostartActivity" and set its "exported" flag to "true". When the app is started with this activity, the "Stopwatch" tab is selected. If the stopwatch is in a "stopped" state, then it is reset and started. If the stopwatch is in a "started" state, then a new "lap" is created.

I use this most when cooking/grilling/brewing. Throw the meat on the grill, wave the Nexus 7 over the tag, then, move on.

Thanks...

title: License??
body:
Would be great to include Timer in the FOSS-Market f-droid, see:
http://f-droid.org/forums/topic/timer/

To do this we need a license text. Please add it. 

P.S.: It is also possible to include a donation button there, see:
http://f-droid.org/forums/topic/about-this-forum/

title: force close on honeycomb with talkback (low-vision accessibility) enabled
body:
this was a report sent in from google play.  of the devices I tried (gingerbread, honeycomb, and ICS) it only happens on honeycomb.  talkback must be enabled, under accessibility, to cause the force close.  here's the stack trace from the google play report:
